question.questionA: Submerged marine plants with linear grass-like leaves.
question.questionB: Submerged or floating plants of fresh or brackish water.

question.questionA: Creeping stems stout with numerous brown fibres.
Leaves usually 5-8 mm wide; carpels enclosed in a sheath.
question.questionB: Leaves approximately 1 mm wide, carpels long-stalked.
question.answerA: Leaves approximately 1 mm wide, carpels long-stalked.

question.questionB: Carpels sessile in a dense terminal cluster.

question.questionA: Peduncles less than 6 cm, flexuous in fruit.
question.questionB: Peduncles more than 8 cm, spirally coiled in fruit.

question.questionA: All  leaves submerged, minutely serrulate,  undulate on maturity; fruit 4-5 mm with beak more than half length of fruit.
question.questionB: Some leaves floating; fruit with beak less than a quarter the length of the fruit.

question.questionA: Leaves linear, usually less than 2 mm wide; fruit 3-5 mm.
question.questionB: Leaves broadly ovate, usually greater than 20 mm wide; fruit less than 2 mm.
